member.name: M:Spea.CanInstruments.DcGen.On(System.Double,System.Double,Spea.DcGenOut,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Connects, sets and enables the DC Generator.
The DC output is set to a value of [V] with a current limit of [A].
A delay can be necessary after the DC Generator is enabled before the voltage can be measured on output, this time can be adjusted with [ms].
member.param: The output voltage [V].
The current limit [A].
The connection point for the output.
The time delay after DC generator is enabled or set.

member.name: M:Spea.CanInstruments.DcGen.Off(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the DC Generator to its minimal voltage and current, then after a delay, it disables and disconnects the DC Generator.
After setting the DC Generator to its minimal voltage, a delay can be necessary before disabling and disconnecting it. This delay can be adjusted with [ms].
member.param: The time delay before disabling DC generator, after its voltage is set to the minimal value.

member.name: M:Spea.CanInstruments.DcGen.Set(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets new values for the output of this DC Generator.
member.param: The output voltage [V].
The current limit [A].

member.name: M:Spea.Dvm.AutoMeasureDc(Spea.DvmHotConnectionPoint,Spea.DvmColdConnectionPoint,System.Double@,System.Double,Spea.DvmVRange)
member.summary:
Measures a DC-Voltage with the DVM. Does the connect, measure and disconnect automatically.
8 Rows Pre-requirement 1: Before connecting DVM to rows 5, 6, 7 or 8 it is necessary to change the ABUS Channel Mode by calling .
member.param: DVM connection hot point.
DVM connection cold point.
Measured value in volts.
Measure Time (T_ON) in seconds.
The voltage range for the measurement.
member.returns: If measurement was successful or , if the value measured was over the selected voltage range.
member.exception: If DVM can't be configured or measurement can't be acquired.

member.name: M:Spea.Dvm.Connect(Spea.DvmHotConnectionPoint,Spea.DvmColdConnectionPoint)
member.summary:
Connects DVM.
8 Rows Pre-requirement 1: Before connecting DVM to rows 5, 6, 7 or 8 it is necessary to change the ABUS Channel Mode by calling .
member.param: DVM connection hot point.
DVM connection cold point.
member.exception: If DVM can't be connected to the given connection points.

member.name: M:Spea.Dvm.Disconnect(Spea.DvmHotConnectionPoint,Spea.DvmColdConnectionPoint)
member.summary:
Disconnects DVM.
8 Rows Pre-requirement 1: Before connecting DVM to rows 5, 6, 7 or 8 it is necessary to change the ABUS Channel Mode by calling .
member.param: DVM connection hot point.
DVM connection cold point.
member.exception: If DVM can't be disconnected from the given connection points.

member.name: M:Spea.Dvm.ManualMeasureDc(System.Double@,System.Double,Spea.DvmVRange)
member.summary:
Sets DVM and measures a DC value. Connect and disconnect has to be done manually.
To connect and disconnect automatically use .
member.param: Measured value in volts.
Measure Time (T_ON) in seconds.
The voltage range for the measurement.
member.returns: If measurement was successful or , if the value measured was over the selected voltage range.
member.exception: If DVM can't be configured or measurement can't be acquired.

member.name: M:Spea.IniFile.GetPrivateProfileString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a string from the specified section in an initialization file.
member.param: The name of the section containing the key name. If this parameter is NULL, the GetPrivateProfileString function copies all section names in the file to the supplied buffer.

The name of the key whose associated string is to be retrieved. If this parameter is NULL, all key names in the section specified by the lpAppName parameter are copied to the buffer specified by the lpReturnedString parameter.

A default string. If the lpKeyName key cannot be found in the initialization file, GetPrivateProfileString copies the default string to the lpReturnedString buffer. If this parameter Is NULL, the Default Is an empty String, "". Avoid specifying a Default String With trailing blank characters. The Function inserts a null character In the lpReturnedString buffer To strip any trailing blanks.
A pointer to the buffer that receives the retrieved string.
The size of the buffer pointed to by the lpReturnedString parameter, in characters.
The name of the initialization file. If this parameter does not contain a full path to the file, the system searches for the file in the Windows directory.
member.returns: The return value is the number of characters copied to the buffer, not including the terminating null character.

member.name: M:Spea.IniFile.WritePrivateProfileString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies a string into the specified section of an initialization file.
member.param: The name of the section to which the string will be copied. If the section does not exist, it is created. The name of the section is case-independent; the string can be any combination of uppercase and lowercase letters.

The name of the key to be associated with a string. If the key does not exist in the specified section, it is created. If this parameter is NULL, the entire section, including all entries within the section, is deleted.
A null-terminated string to be written to the file. If this parameter is NULL, the key pointed to by the lpKeyName parameter is deleted.
The name of the initialization file. If the file was created using Unicode characters, the function writes Unicode characters to the file.Otherwise, the function writes ANSI characters.
member.returns: If the function successfully copies the string to the initialization file, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, or if it flushes the cached version of the most recently accessed initialization file, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Spea.Instruments.Stimulus.SetStimulus(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Configures and enables the Stimulus to supply the selected with a limit.
The parameters and are used to check if the current being sourced or drained by the Stimulus after it is enabled is inside an allowed range.
If any of the two parameters is different than 0, a current test will be executed with this ranges, otherwise a current test will be performed with the maximal configurable current for the specific Stimulus.
member.param: The voltage that should be supplied by the Stimulus.
The current limit for the Stimulus.
The current measured on the device if any limit different than 0 was passed to this method.
The lower limit of the allowed range for the current. If different than 0, a current test will be performed after Stimulus is enabled.
The upper limit of the allowed range for the current.If different than 0, a current test will be performed after Stimulus is enabled.
member.returns: if the test is perfomed and the current is outside of the allowed range, otherwise it returns .
member.exception: If status of a Leo-F method isn't .

member.summary: Measures the current being supplied or drained by the Stimulus and test it against an allowed range.
member.param: The lower limit of the allowed range in ampere.
The upper limit of the allowed range in ampere.
[Output] The value that was measured.
The On time of the analog timing for one cycle in milliseconds.
The number of DVM cycles used to calculate the average of the measured value [minimum = 1].
member.returns: if current is the allowed range, otherwise .

The upper limit of the allowed range in volts.
[Output] The value that was measured.
The On time of the analog timing for one cycle in milliseconds.
The number of DVM cycles used to calculate the average of the measured value [minimum = 1].
member.returns: if current is the allowed range, otherwise .

member.summary:
Configures and enables the Stimulus to supply the selected with a limit.
The parameters and are used to check if the current being sourced or drained by the Stimulus after it is enabled is inside an allowed range.
If any of the two parameters is different than 0, a current test will be executed with this ranges, otherwise a current test will be performed with the maximal configurable current for the specific Stimulus.
If is set to false, the measurement will not be performed.
member.param: The voltage that should be supplied by the Stimulus.
The current limit for the Stimulus.
The current measured on the device if any limit different than 0 was passed to this method.
The lower limit of the allowed range for the current. If different than 0, a current test will be performed after Stimulus is enabled.
The upper limit of the allowed range for the current.If different than 0, a current test will be performed after Stimulus is enabled.
A value indicating if the measurement should be performed.
member.returns: if the test is perfomed and the current is outside of the allowed range, otherwise it returns .
member.exception: If status of a Leo-F method isn't .

member.summary: The AcGenDisconnect instruction disconnects the AC Generator module from the System Interface.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AcGenEnable(Spea.InstrAcGen)
member.summary:
The AcGenEnable instruction enables the AC Generator module.
Important Note Programming and connection must be executed before the unit enabling. The execution time of this instruction includes the relays switching time. In practice the instrument connection and disconnection must occur in two times in order to avoid damages to the connection relays. 1st Test: Programs (AcGenSourceSet) and connects (AcGenConnect) 2nd Test: Switches on the module (AcGenEnable).
member.param: AC Generator module identifier.
member.returns: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors. | ERR_ACGEN_NOT_PRESENT -> The AC Generator module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AcGenOff(Spea.InstrAcGen)
member.summary: The AcGenOff instruction allows to switch OFF the AC Generator module.
member.param: AC Generator module identifier.
member.returns: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors. | ERR_ACGEN_NOT_PRESENT -> The AC Generator module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AcGenOn(Spea.InstrAcGen,System.Double,Spea.VoltRangeAcGen,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The AcGenOn instruction allows to switch ON the AC Generator module.
member.param: AC Generator module identifier.
It identifies the output voltage value to generate expressed in Volt. Possible values are: 1-300.
It identifies the voltage range to generate expressed in Volt.
The output current value has to be set at the same value of Ilimit parameter.

param.name: iLimit
param.para: It identifies the maximum current limit value expressed in Ampere. Possible values are:
ACG110 0.1 15A | Current value for voltages > 150V. | Rms I limit .
ACG130 2.04 20A | Current value for voltages > 150V. | Peak I limit value .
1.02 20A | Current value for voltages 150V. | I limit Rms fixed at 5.33A / 2.66A .
ACG140 0.1 15A | Current value for voltages > 150V. | Rms I limit .

member.param: It identifies the frequency value to generate expressed in MHz. Possible values are: 40 - 500.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_ACGEN_NOT_PRESENT -> The AC Generator module is not present.
ERR_ACGEN_V_VALUE -> The voltage value parameter is not valid.
ERR_ACGEN_V_RANGE -> The voltage range parameter is not valid.
ERR_ACGEN_I_VALUE -> The current value parameter is not valid.
ERR_ACGEN_I_LIMIT -> The current limit parameter is not valid.
ERR_ACGEN_FREQUENCY -> The frequency value is not valid.

member.summary: The ACLineSyncSet instruction connects/disconnects the AC synchronism line to the Synchro Bus (this line is derived from the system AC power supply).

It identifies the line of the Synchro Bus used for the connection.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlIdle

summary.para: The AnlIdle instruction sets all the analog module units in Idle status.
The analog module consists of:
-Instruments.
-Scanners.
-Analog Timing.
-Various settings as relay mode, wait time, etc.
-Note: The connections to the Synchro Bus (Sbus/Esbus) are not reset by this instruction, but by SbusIdle instruction.

member.returns: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors. | ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.

ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlPhaseSet(Spea.AnlPhase,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AnlPhaseSet instruction programs the analog timing phases.
member.param: It identifies the analog phase to be configured.
Toff1 programming value (in sec). Resolution: 1*10-6 (1s). Possible values: 0 - 4294.6s.
Ton programming value (in sec). Resolution: 1*10-6 (1s). Possible values: 1*10-6(1s) - 4294.6s.
Toff2 programming value (in sec). Resolution: 1*10-6 (1s). Possible values: 0 - 4294.6s.
Number of cycles.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.
ERR_PHASE_NOT_VALID -> The PhaseId parameter is not valid.
ERR_INV_TON_TOFF -> The parameter Ton or Toff1 or Toff2 is not valid.
ERR_INV_CYCLES -> The Cycles parameter is out of range.

member.summary: The AnlRelayModeSet instruction selects the scanners relays switching mode. There are two modalities: SWITCHING and LATCHING.
member.param: It identifies the aswitching mode for the analog relays.
member.returns: ??? is not documented.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlRelayTimeSet(Spea.AnlRelTime)

summary.para: The AnlRelayTimeSet instruction sets the relays switching time on the analog module scanners and instruments.

This wait time is the time needed to complete a relay switching instruction. At the moment the relays switching time is fixed, and its value depends on the instruction. This instruction is provided for future use.

member.param: Defines the switching time.
member.returns: ??? is not documented.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlTaskMeasStoreDisable
member.summary: This instruction disables the storing execution of the analog task measurement.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlTaskMeasStoreEnable
member.summary: This instruction enables the storing execution of the analog task measurement.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlTimeoutSet(System.Int32)

summary.para: The AnlTimeoutSet instruction controls the time-out on the analog test start.

When the start test source is not IMMEDIATE, the time-out is enabled by default (see the AnlTimingStartModeSet instruction). If the programmed starting event does not occur until the time-out, then the analog test execution is aborted, and a warning message is displayed.The test result is FAIL.

member.param: Timeout value in ms. The default time-out value is 100ms.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.
ERR_INV_TIMEOUT -> The Timeout parameter is out of range.

summary.para: The AnlTimingDisable instruction disables the analog timing.
This disabling concerns the whole "Analog Timing" instrument, however it works (both with the internal generator and with the signals coming from an external source).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.

summary.para: The AnlTimingEnable instruction enables the analog timing.
This enabling concerns the whole "Analog Timing" instrument, however it works (both with the internal generator and with the signals coming from an external source).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.

summary.para: The AnlTimingIdle instruction sets the analog timing in idle/default status. Idle/default status is the following:
- Toff1/Toff2/Ton of all the phases = 1s.
- Number of cycles of all the phases = 1.
- Disabled phases.
- Source of the timing output signals = internal generator.
- Timing start source = internal.
- Time-out 100ms.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlTimingOutSourceSet(Spea.OutSource)

summary.para: The AnlTimingOutSourceSet instruction determines which is the analog timing outputs source.
It is possible to connect an external signal source to the system interface and use it to generate the timing outputs.
When working in this mode, the internal timing generator does nothing and its outputs are driven by the signals on the system interface (INPSYNC[1..4] signals).

This functionality can be used only during the execution of a functional test program. It has been implemented to maintain the compatibility with the systems of previous generations.The same functionality can be now obtained with the Synchro Bus correct connection.
The signals on the system interface controlling this mode are:
Signal | Reference ground | Active level | Description.
ENEXTIMA | GND_ENEXTIMA | H | Enables the external timing source. To use this feature it has to be enabled both by this instruction and by this input.
INPSYNC1,INPSYNC2,INPSYNC3,INPSYNC4 | GND_INPSYNC | H | Signals.
Outputname | Source Signal.
ATEST | INPSYNC1 .
APH1 | INPSYNC2 .
APH2 | INPSYNC3 .
APH3 | INPSYNC4 .
APH4 | Idle .
SYNCFREQ | Idle .

member.param: Output source. The OS_INTERNAL mode is set by default at the start of the test program.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.
ERR_INV_OUT_SOURCE -> The OutSource parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlTimingStartModeSet(Spea.StartSource,Spea.StartMode,Spea.StartPol)

summary.para: The AnlTimingStartModeSet instruction selects the start source of the analog test.
Notes:
1.)The meaning of the two StartMode and StartPol parameters is the following:
If StartSource = IMMEDIATE, they have no meaning.
If StartSource = ACLINE, only the StartPol parameter is meaningful because the test will always start on an edge of the AC synchronism line(this line is derived by the system AC power supply).
StartPol | Meaning.
DIRECT | Start on the rising zero-crossing of the AC-Signal.
StartPol | Start on the falling zero-crossing of the AC-Signal.
2.)If StartSource = all the other values, the meaning of the two combined StartMode and StartPol parameters is the following:
StartMode | StartPol | Meaning.
LEVEL | DIRECT | Start on Active (H) level of the chosen signal.
LEVEL | INVERTED | Start on Inactive (L) level of the chosen signal.
EDGE | DIRECT | Start on positive edge of the chosen signal.
EDGE | INVERTED | Start on negative edge of the chosen signal.
3.)The UNRELEVANT value is used as filler when the parameter has no meaning.

member.param: StartSource.
StartMode.
StartPol.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.
ERR_INV_START_SOURCE -> The StartSource parameter is not valid.
ERR_INV_START_MODE -> The StartMode parameter is not valid.
ERR_INV_START_POLE -> The StartPole parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.AnlTimingSyncSet(Spea.AnlTimingSyncFlagID,Spea.SbusLine)

summary.para: The AnlTimingSyncSet instruction controls the connection of analog timing inputs and outputs to the Synchro Bus (SBUS/ESBUS).
The inputs flags are the following:
ATIMSTARTS = Start of the Timing coming from SBUS.
ATIMSTARTE = Start of the Timing coming from ESBUS.
The outputs are the following:
ATEST = Analog test.
APH1 APH4 = Analog phase 1 to 4.

member.param: Flag IDs.
E/SBUS Line Connection.
member.returns: ??? not documented maybe in summary described outputs.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.CntEventSet(Spea.CntInstrId,Spea.CntVoltRange,System.Double,Spea.CntSlope)
member.summary: The CntEventSet instruction allows to set the counter for event count measurement.
member.param: Unit identifier.
It identifies the range for the signal. HV not possible for YAICT.

param.name: threshold
param.para: It identifies the voltage of threshold (it is expressed in Volts). When the counter is connected to the input stage of the measurement unit(CntConnectDvm) the threshold must be programmed according to the DVM input stage and range:.
HV LZ or HV HZ | 1V | x10 .
HV LZ or HV HZ | 10V | x1 .

member.param: It identifies the slope of triggering signal.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PMU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PMU module is not present.
ERR_PMU_RANGE -> The Range parameter is not valid.
ERR_PMU_VTRIGGER -> The Threshlod parameter is out of range.
ERR_PMU_SLOPE -> The Slope parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.DcGenEnable(Spea.DcGenInstrId)

summary.para: The DcGenEnable instruction enables the DC Generator module.
Programming and connection must be executed before the unit enabling. The execution time of this instruction includes the relays switching time.
In practice the instrument connection and disconnection must occur in two times in order to avoid damages to the connection relays.

member.param: It identifies the DC Generator module to be enabled.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_DCGEN_NOT_PRESENT -> The DC Generator module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.DigTimAcquisitionRead(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double}@)
member.summary: The DigTimAcquisitionRead instruction allows to read the result of the acquisition performed on the selected testpoint.
member.param: It identifies the testpoint associated to the Main or Auxiliary Channel where it is present the acquiring signal.
It identifies the maximum time (expressed in milliseconds) waited by the instruction until the measure is finished. Values must be lower or euqal to 65 seconds.
It identifies the maximum number of edges to be acquired for the selected testpoint. It must be greater or equal to the number of edges to be acquired in order to avoid arrays overflow.
It contains the quantity of the acquired edges.
It identifies the array containing the sequence of the logic levels of the signal present on the selected testpoint.
It identifies the array containing the time between the starting edge and each transition of the signal present on the selected testpoint.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_DIG_TP_NOT_VALID -> Testpoint not valid.
ERR_DIG_TP_NOT_SET_FOR_ACQ -> Testpoint not previously set for the acquisition.
ERR_DIG_ACQ_TIMEOUT -> Timeout during acquisition.
ERR_DIG_ACQ_MEMORY_FULL -> Acquisitions number exceeds maximum storable quantity.
ERR_DIG_START_STROBE_MISSING -> Start strobe missing.
ERR_DIG_ACQ_OVERFLOW -> Maximum measurable time expired (related to the selected resolution).

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.DigTimAcquisitionSet(System.Int32,Spea.CntSlope,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The DigTimAcquisitionSet instruction allows to prepare the time interval meter to the acquisition on the selected testpoints.
member.param: It identifies the testpoint associated to the Main Channe.
It identifies the slope of the signal present on the Main Channel where the acquisition starts.
It identifies the testpoint associated to the Auxiliary Channel. Possible values are 'NONE' and greater or equal to 1.
It identifies the active level for the acquisition start enable signal.
It identifies the testpoint associated to the Enable Channel in case of EnableLevel is different from NONE. Possible values are 'NONE' and greater or equal to 1.
It identifies the number of edges to be acquired, contained in the signal present on Main Channel. This value must be included between 1 and 128.
Resolution.

returns.para: Resolution: , or .

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.DriClear(Spea.DriverId)
member.summary:
The DriClear instruction allows to set the specified driver module to the default values. The instruction executes automatically all the sequences required to disconnect the driver module.
Enable - OFF.
Voltage - 0V.
Current - 10mA.
OutMode - DIRECT.
OutTiming - CONT_ON.
SlewRate - NORMAL.
ByPass - BY_PASS_OFF.
CONNECTION: HOT - NOT_CONN / COLD - NOT_CONN.
member.param: Driver identifier.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_SU_NOT_PRESENT -> The SU module is not present.

member.param: It identifies the driver module to be connected on ABUS.
It identifies the positive pole of the driver module.
It identifies the negative pole of the driver module.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_SU_NOT_PRESENT -> The SU module is not present.

member.param: It identifies the driver module to be connected on ABUS.
It identifies the points to be connected to the System Interface.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_SU_NOT_PRESENT -> The SU module is not present.
ERR_SU_POINT -> The Point parameter is not valid.

It identifies the UABUS row to connect with the negative pole of the driver module.

It identifies the UABUS row to connect with the sense negative pole of the driver module.

It identifies the output voltage.

summary.para: The DvmTrigSet instruction enables to program the source and the reference voltage for measurement trigger [NOT AVAILABLE FOR YAICT].

Note: For the measurement in TRIGGER mode, the measurement trigger is obtained by using the counter comparator (Ch 1 > Ch A). For the input connection of the trigger comparator, the specific connection functions of the CNT1 section must be used.

member.param: It identifies the measurement module to be set.
It identifies the input voltage of the Counter channel 1.
It identifies the slope of triggering signal.
It identifies the trigger voltage. It is expressed in Volts.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PMU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PMU module is not present.
ERR_PMU_INP_STAGE -> The InputStage parameter is not valid.
ERR_PMU_SLOPE -> The Slope parameter is not valid.
ERR_PMU_VTRIGGER -> The Vtrigger parameter is not valid.

summary.para: The InsulatedChConnect instruction allows the connection of all the insulated channels to the System Interface.
Notes:
1) The execution of this instruction is 15ms (only if insulated channels are not already connected).
2) The connection of the insulated channels is inhibited if the EXTCSEZHV signal in interface is active or if a generator (ACGEN or DCGEN) is connected).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

summary.para: The InsulatedChDisconnect instruction allows the disconnection of all the insulated channels from the System Interface.
Note: The execution of this instruction is 10ms (only if insulated channels are not already disconnected).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

It identifies the status of the offset correction (trim) for the saturation value of HSL color space.

It identifies the status of the offset correction (trim) for the X value of XY color space.
It identifies the status of the offset correction (trim) for the Y value of XY color space.
It identifies the status of the offset correction (trim) for the value of visible light.
It identifies the status of the offset correction (trim) for the value of infrared light.
member.returns: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.MsgDispService(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MsgDispService instruction displays the specified message in the service message area of the Control Panel.
member.param: It identifies the message to show in the Control Panel service message area.
It identifies the flag to determine whether a new line character must be appended at the end of the string or not. By default the flag is 0, and this means that there is a string on each line.

summary.para: After the ObpAsyncModeEnable instruction, the next OBP instruction is executed in asynchronous mode.

summary.para: The ObpChipEraseVerify instruction executes the memory erasure of the programmable component, and then verifies if the whole memory is clear.
If during the data deletion, or the verification, an error occurs the instruction will return a value not equal 0, otherwise it will return 0.

Data format.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

Channel.

ERR_OBP_NOT_PRESENT -> The OBP module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.ObpLoadDataFileSVF(Spea.ObpID,System.String,System.Double,System.Int32,Spea.SVFFileOptions,System.Int32@)

summary.para: The ObpLoadDataFileSVF instruction allows loading data files in SVF format into the OBP module memory.

member.param: ObpId.
It identifies the name of the file to be loaded in memory.
It identifies the frequency (in Hz) to be used in case it is not defined in the file. This parameter is ignored ff the frequency is defined in the file or if the value 0 is defined.

It identifies the number of time that the RUNTEST instruction is executed again before to set the error. If the parameter is 0, the retries are not executed.Usually the parameter has to be 0, only in some cases it is required(e.g.Xilinx device).
It identifies the files loading options.
It is the pointer to the memory address where the file must to be loaded.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_OBP_ID -> The ObpId parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_NOT_PRESENT -> The OBP module is not present.
ERR_OBP_FILENAME -> The FileName parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_SVF_FREQUENCY -> The RetryNumber parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_SVF_RETRY_NB -> The FileName parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_SVF_OPTIONS -> The Options parameter is not valid.

summary.para: The ObpVerifyData instruction allows to verify the presence of an specific value in an defined address of the device.

member.param: ObpId.
Data format for verification.
Component memory address to be checked.
It identifies the value to be checked.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_OBP_ID -> The ObpId parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_NOT_PRESENT -> The OBP module is not present.
ERR_OBP_DATATYPE -> The DataType parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.ObpVerifyDataArray(Spea.ObpID,Spea.DataType,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte})

summary.para: The ObpVerifyDataArray instruction verifies a specific array of data starting from a specified devices memory address.

member.param: ObpId.
Data format.
Address where to start verify data array from.
It identifies the pointer to the array of data to verify.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_OBP_ID -> The ObpId parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_NOT_PRESENT -> The OBP module is not present.
ERR_OBP_DATATYPE -> The DataType parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.ObpVerifyFile(Spea.ObpID,Spea.DataType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: The ObpVerifyFile instruction executes the verification of the component using the information stored in a file previously loaded by using the ObpLoadDataFile instruction.
The instruction can verify the entire file in the device, or a part of it. The user can set where the file has to be verified in the device.

member.param: ObpId.
Data format.
identifies the file to be used (specified in the ObpLoadDataFile instruction).
AIt identifies the device start address for data writing.
It identifies the file start address for data writing.
It is an hexadecimal number that identifies the data length to be verified.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_OBP_ID -> The ObpId parameter is not valid.
ERR_OBP_NOT_PRESENT -> The OBP module is not present.
ERR_OBP_DATATYPE -> The DataType parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.ObsDatalogTest(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Spea.TestResult,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)

summary.para: The ObsDatalogTest instruction stores test information into Spea Datalog files.
The TestNumber, Remark and TestResult parameters must have valid values to store data into the Spea Datalog files.
The DrawingReference, MeasuredValueStr, ThrLowStr, ThrHighStr and TpListStr parameters are ignored if their value is an empty string (" ").
The SiteNumber parameter is ignored if the Test program is not a Multi Site one.

member.param: It identifies the number of test.
It identifies the the name of the component.
It identifies the test remark.
It identifies the test result.
It identifies the measured value.
It identifies the low threshold value.
It identifies the high threshold value.
It identifies the list of Test points.
It identifies the reference site number.

The maximal length of the .

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinAttributeSet(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluLinPorts},Spea.PluLinAttributes,System.Int32)

summary.para: The PluLinAttributeSet instruction allows to set the communication attributes used by the specified list of LIN ports.
Note: The communication attributes settings have to be performed before the LIN port opening (the instruction has to be used before the PluLinOpen instruction).

member.param: It indentifies the array of LIN port to be set.
It identifies the type of attribute to be set.
It identifies the value to be set to the attribute.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_LIN_ATTRIBUTE_ID -> The AttributeId parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_LIN_BAUDRATE -> The Baudrate parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_LIN_CHECKSUM -> The CheckSum parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinClose(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluLinPorts})

summary.para: The PluLinClose instruction allows to close the LIN ports previously opened.
Note: The instruction is ignored if it is executed on a LIN port already close.

member.param: It indentifies the array of LIN port to be closed.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinConnect(Spea.PluLinPorts,System.Int16,System.Int16)

summary.para: The PluLinConnect instruction allows to associate the LIN port with the couple of channels to be used.
This instruction does not execute a physically connection of the channels but it creates only a logical association.
The associations and setting have to be performed using the suitable instructions.

member.param: It indentifies the LIN port to be associated with the channels.
It identifies the output channels used for data transmission. This channel is the one connected with the transceiver input.
It identifies the input channels used for data receiption. This channel is the one connected with the transceiver output.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinDisconnect(Spea.PluLinPorts)

summary.para: The PluLinDisconnect instruction allows to delete the association of the LIN port with the couple of channels performed through the PluLinConnect instruction.
Note: This instruction execute automatically the closing of the opened LIN ports (PluLinClose instruction).

member.param: It indentifies the LIN port to be disassociated with the channels.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

summary.para: The PluLinDisconnectAll instruction allows to delete the channels associations of all LIN ports.
Note: This instruction execute automatically the closing of the opened LIN ports (PluLinClose instruction).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinFrameRead(Spea.PluLinPorts,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Byte}@)

summary.para: The PluLinFrameRead instruction allows to read the data received by the PluLinFrameSendReceive instruction execution. The data are read singly from each LIN port.
This instruction has to be executed after the PluLinFrameSendReceive instruction.
In order to read several data frames it is required to execure the PluLinFrameRead instruction after each PluLinFrameSendReceive instruction. It is important in order to avoid data loss.
The PluLinFrameRead instruction can be executed several times consecutively.

member.param: It indentifies the LIN port to be used.
It is the identifier of the received frame data.
It identifies the length of the received frame data.
It identifies the array of data to be received.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_LIN_NUMBER -> The PortId parameter is not valid.
LIN_SEND_ECHO_MISSING -> Error while sending frame (missing echo of bytes send).
LIN_SEND_ECHO_ERROR -> Error while sending frame (wrong echo of bytes send).
LIN_RECEIVE_TIMEOUT -> Timeout during frame reception.
LIN_CHECKSUM_ERROR -> Wrong checksum of the received frame.
LIN_FRAME_MISSING -> No frame available in the receive buffer (PluFrameSendReceive not executed correctly).

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinFrameSend(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluLinPorts},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte},System.Collections.Generic.List{Spea.PluLinSendResult}@)

summary.para: The PluLinFrameSend instruction allows to send a transmition data frame from the indicated LIN port.
All frame data (including the Header and the Response) are sent from the system LIN port.
The CheckSum is calculated according to the settings defined with the PluLinAttributeSet instruction.
The required Inter-frame space has to be inserted by the programmer (for example using the SysWait instruction).

member.param: It indentifies the array of LIN port to be used.
It is the identifier of the frame data to be sent.
It identifies the length of the frame data to be sent.
It identifies the array of data to be sent.
It identifies the results of each LIN port.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_LIN_FRAME_ID -> The FrameId parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_LIN_FRAME_DATA_LEN -> The FrameDataLen parameter is not valid.
FAIL -> The instruction has been executed with errors. Check the ResultsList for detailed information.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinFrameSendReceive(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluLinPorts},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Spea.PluLinSendResult}@)

summary.para: The PluLinFrameSend instruction allows to send a transmition data frame from the indicated LIN port.
All frame data (including the Header and the Response) are sent from the system LIN port.
The CheckSum is calculated according to the settings defined with the PluLinAttributeSet instruction.
The required Inter-frame space has to be inserted by the programmer (for example using the SysWait instruction).

member.param: It indentifies the array of LIN port to be used.
It is the identifier of the frame data to be sent.
It identifies the length of the frame data to be received.
It identifies the results of each LIN port.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_LIN_FRAME_ID -> The FrameId parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_LIN_FRAME_DATA_LEN -> The FrameDataLen parameter is not valid.
FAIL -> The instruction has been executed with errors. Check the ResultsList for detailed information.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluLinOpen(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluLinPorts})

summary.para: The PluLinOpen instruction allows to open the LIN port previously connected through the PluLinConnect instruction.

member.param: It indentifies the array of LIN port to be opened.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComAsyncConfig(Spea.PluComPorts,System.Int32,Spea.PluIdleLevel,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: The PluSerComAsyncConfig instruction configures the operating mode of the specified port. The configuration is possible only if the port is closed.

member.param: It indentifies the array of LIN port to be opened.
It identifies the baudrate for the serial communication. (9600-5000000).
It identifies the transmission line idle state.
It identifies the output digital channel used for data transmission.
It identifies the input digital channel used for data reception.
It identifies the bit sequence idle data. Valid only if IdleLevel parameter is set to BIT_SEQUENCE.
It identifies the length of the bit sequence idle data.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_NUMBER -> The PortId parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_BAUDRATE -> The Baudrate parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_IDLE_LEVEL -> The IdleLevel parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_CH_TX -> The ChanTx parametere is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_CH_RX -> The ChanRx parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_BIT_SEQUENCE_QTY -> The BitSequenceQty is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComClose(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluComPorts})

summary.para: The PluSerComClose instruction closes the specified ports and remove the connection of the associated channels.

member.param: It identifies the null-terminated array of used ports (it must be terminated with 0).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComDataReceive(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluComPorts},System.Int32)

summary.para: The PluSerComDataReceive instruction schedule the reception from the specified port (without comparison).

member.param: It identifies the null-terminated array of used ports (it must be terminated with 0).
It identifies the number of bits scheduled for reception.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_BIT_QTY -> The BitQty parameter is not valid.
FAIL -> The instruction has been executed with FAIL result.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComDataSend(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluComPorts},System.String,System.Int32)

summary.para: The PluSerComDataSend instruction sends a buffer message to the specified port.
The data of each single byte are serialized MSB-first and they are aligned to the least significant bit.
The data will be sent when the PluSerComRun instructions is executed.
This instruction requires that the ports has been opened previously using the PluSerComOpen instruction.

member.param: It identifies the null-terminated array of used ports (it must be terminated with 0).
It identifies the buffer of bits scheduled for transmission.
It identifies the number of bits scheduled for transmission.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_BIT_QTY -> The BitQty parameter is not valid.
FAIL -> The instruction has been executed with FAIL result.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComOpen(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluComPorts})

summary.para: The PluSerComOpen instruction sets the communication attributes used by the specified list of ports.
When this instruction is executed, the channels of the specified port are enabled and set in the indicated idle status (level or bit sequence).
Note: This instruction requires that the ports has been configured previously using the PluSerComAsyncConfig instruction.

member.param: It identifies the null-terminated array of used ports (it must be terminated with 0).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComRead(Spea.PluComPorts,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Byte}@,System.Int32@)

summary.para: The PluSerComRead instruction reads the data received by the PluSerComRun instruction.
The data are read in the same order (for number of bit) of the programmed receiving.
The data of each single byte are serialized MSB-first and they are aligned to the least significant bit (same format of the instruction).

member.param: It identifies the port to read.
It identifies the number of bits to be read.
It identifies the buffer that will contains the read data (filled by the operation).
It identifies the number of bits read by the operation.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_NUMBER -> The PortId parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_BIT_DATA_LEN -> The BitDataLen parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerComRun(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluComPorts},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Spea.TestResult@)

summary.para: The PluSerComRun instruction enables the programmed data transmission/receiving and waits the end within the timeout. It allows to specify the receiving start condition to be used.

member.param: It identifies the null-terminated array of used ports (it must be terminated with 0).
It identifies the number of bits to be read.
It identifies the buffer that will contains the read data (filled by the operation).
It identifies the number of bits read by the operation.
It identifies the operation result for each port.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_RX_START_CONDITION_BIT_QTY -> The RxStartConditionBitQty parameter is not valid.
ERR_PLU_SERCOM_TIMEOUT -> The Timeout parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerialPortChAssign(Spea.PluASCPort,System.Int16,System.Int16)

summary.para: The PluSerialPortChAssign instruction allows to associate the ASC port with the couple of channels to be used.

The associations and setting have to be performed using the suitable instrunctions.

It identifies the output channels used for data transmission.
It identifies the input channels used for data receiption.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerialPortClose(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluASCPort})

summary.para: The PluSerialPortClose instruction allows to close the ASC ports previously opened and remove the connection of the associated channels.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerialPortOpen(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluASCPort},System.Int32,System.Int32,Spea.PluSerialParityBit,Spea.PluSerialStopBits)

summary.para: The PluSerialPortOpen instruction allows to set the communication attributes used by the specified list of ASC ports.

member.param: It indentifies the array of ASC port to be closed.
It identifies the baudrate to be set.
It identifies the data bit number.
It identifies the parity bit that allows to check the received data correctness.
It identifies the stop time. It can have several standard lengths (one or two time of bit).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerialPortReceive(Spea.PluASCPort,System.String@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32)

summary.para: The PluSerialPortReceive instruction allows to receive a buffer data from the specified ASC port.
Note: This instruction requires that the ASC ports has been opened previously using the PluSerialPortOpen instruction.

member.param: It indentifies the ASC port to be used.
It identifies the received buffer data.
It identifies the maximum number of data to be received (512 characters max.). When the specified number of character is read from the port, the data reading is stopped.

It identifies the data ending character. If this parameter is specified, it allows to stop the data reading when they are received. The ending character is also present in the received buffer data. Note: The value -1 allows to ignore the parameter.
It identifies the stop time. It can have several standard lengths (one or two time of bit).
It identifies the data timeout reading expressed in milliseconds (10s max.).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ASC_TIMEOUT -> The receive is not completed within the maximum specified time.
ASC_OVERRUN_ERROR -> Overrun error occurs on serial port.
ASC_FRAME_ERROR -> Frame error occurs during data receive (at least on one character).
ASC_PARITY_ERROR -> Parity error occurs during data receive (at least on one character).

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PluSerialPortSend(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Spea.PluASCPort},System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@)

summary.para: The PluSerialPortSend instruction allows to send a buffer message to the specified ASC port.
Note: This instruction requires that the ASC ports has been opened previously using the PluSerialPortOpen instruction.

member.param: It indentifies the array of ASC port to be closed.
It identifies the buffer data to be sent.
It identifies the number of data to be sent (512 characters max.).
This parameter is not documented.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PpsuConnectUabusBmu(Spea.PPS,Spea.Uabus1To4,Spea.Uabus5To8,Spea.Uabus1To4,Spea.Uabus5To8,Spea.Uabus1To4,Spea.Uabus5To8)

It identifies the UABUS row to connect with the 1st negative pole of the programmable power supply.

It identifies the UABUS row to connect with the sense positive pole of the programmable power supply.

Read value.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PPSU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PPSU module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PpsuSourceConnectInterf(Spea.PPS)

summary.para: The PpsuSourceConnectInterf instruction allows the connection of the programmable power supplies with the System Interface.
In order to execute this instruction, the instrument must be disabled.
The execution time of this instruction is 32 ms and includes the relays switching time (10 ms).

member.param: It identifies the programmable power supply to be connected on the System Interface.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PPSU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PPSU module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PpsuSourceDisable(Spea.PPS)

summary.para: The PpsuSourceDisable instruction disables the specified programmable power supply V/I Source section.
Disabling must be executed before the instrument disconnection.
The average execution time of this instruction is 1.2 ms.

member.param: It identifies the section of the programmable power supply V/I Source.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PPSU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PPSU module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PpsuSourceDisconnectInterf(Spea.PPS)

summary.para: The PpsuSourceDisable instruction disables the specified programmable power supply V/I Source section.
In order to execute this instruction, the instrument must be disabled.
The execution time of this instruction is 24 ms and includes the relay switching time (10 ms).

member.param: It identifies the programmable power supply to be disconnected from the System Interface.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PPSU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PPSU module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PpsuSourceEnable(Spea.PPS)

summary.para: The PpsuSourceEnable instruction enables the specified programmable power supply V/I Source section.
The programming and the connection must be executed before enabling the instrument.
The execution time of this instruction includes the relays switching time.In fact, in order to prevent connection relays damages, the instrument must be connected and switched on in two stages:
First test: Connects and programs the instrument (rif.PpsuSourceSet and PpsuSourceConnectInterf instructions).
Second test: Switches on the instrument(rif.PpsuSourceEnable instruction).
The average execution time of this instruction is 1.2 ms.

member.param: It identifies the section of the programmable power supply V/I Source.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PPSU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PPSU module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.PpsuSourceSet(Spea.PPS,System.Double,System.Double)

summary.para: The PpsuSourceSet instruction allows to connect and to program the specified programmable power supply V/I Source section.

member.param: Programmable power supply identifier.
It identifies the output voltage value expressed in Volt (+5V/+24V).
It identifies the output current value expressed in Ampres (+10A/+1.5A).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_PPSU_NOT_PRESENT -> The PPSU module is not present.
ERR_PPSU_V_VALUE -> The Vvalue parameter is out of range.
ERR_PPSU_I_VALUE -> The Ivalue parameter is out of range.

summary.para: The ReceiverDown instruction allows to configure the receiver position. It moves the receiver is in Down position.

The ReceiverUp instruction allows to configure the receiver position. It moves the receiver is in Up position.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.RunA(System.Int32)

summary.para: The RunA instruction executes an analog test. It starts the analog timing and waits for the end of the test.
If it has been decided to connect timing outputs to an external source (refer to the AnlTimingOutSourceSet instruction),.
RunA instruction, even if properly operating, has no effect on the system because the timing outputs are connected elsewhere.

member.param: Id of the analogue test to run.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_AUX_NOT_PRESENT -> The AUX module is not present.
ERR_INV_RELAY_MODE -> Invalid Relay Mode.
ERR_INV_RELAY_TIME -> Invalid Relay Time.
ERR_RUNA_TIMEOUT -> RunA Timeout error.
ERR_RUNA_TIMING_PROG -> RunA Timing programming error.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.RunAIct(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: The RunAIct instruction executes the Analogue Test Plan by specifying the starting and ending test numbers.

member.param: It identifies the Test Plan name to be executed. If the TestPlanName parameter is identified with " ", the current Analogue Test Plan name is selected.
It identifies the test number to start the Analogue Test Plan execution. -1 = start at beginning of testplan.
It identifies the test number to end the Analogue Test Plan execution. -1 = end at end of testplan.

returns.para: TPRJ_RESULT_PASS -> The Analogue Test Plan has been executed with PASS result.
TPRJ_RESULT_FAIL -> The Analogue Test Plan has been executed with FAIL result.
RP3ERR_TPRJ_CANNOT_RUN -> The Analogue Test Plan cannot be run.
RP3ERR_ANL_TPLAN_NOT_FOUND -> The Analogue Test Plan was not found.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.SysWait(System.Int16)

summary.para: The SysWait instruction performs a NULL instruction that lasts the value programmed in the time argument.
This istruction does NOT suspend the testprogram execution, but affects the timing used by the system to execute the instructions.
It is NOT a way to make possible an interaction between the operator and the testprogram, or to show temporized messages on the screen.
For this purpose the Windows OS and the programming languages makes available several functions like Dialog Box, Message Box and Time related instructions.

member.param: It identifies the wait time. It is expressed in milliseconds.

summary.para: The SysWaitForAnswer instruction allows to synchronize the computer CPU with the tester CPU (Test Sequencer).
These 2 CPUs communicate by means of a FIFO interface, through which the computer CPU sends the commands to be executed by the tester CPU.

For most of the sent commands the computer CPU does not wait for any answer from the tester CPU, and continues to execute the testprogram,by sending commands until the FIFO is full, without worrying if all of them have been executed.
For this purpose the Windows OS and the programming languages makes available several functions like Dialog Box, Message Box and Time related instructions.
If WaitForAnswer is reached the computer CPU suspends the testprogram execution until answer from the tester CPU is received.
Due to the different speed can happen that the computer CPU reaches the end of the testprogram ( Stop to the system), and the tester CPU has not ended yet to execute the received commands.
In order to prevent this anomalous situation, the computer CPU automatically executes this instruction at the end of the testprogram, even it is not used by the programmer.

FIXED_DIGITAL -> Test point wired to YASCA with digital and analogue channel.
FIXED_ACTIVE -> Test point wired to ZPROMEA.
FIXED_OBP_ACTIVE -> Test point wired to ZPROMEA with digital I/O.

member.param: It returns the channel number.

param.name: prbAcc
param.para: It returns the list of the probes that can contact the test point. Possible values are:.

It returns the Y coordinate of the test point (in mm).

summary.para: The VariantCompositionNumRead instruction reads the current variant composition number.

member.param: It identifies the variant composition number (returned by this instruction).

returns.para: TRUE -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
FALSE -> The instruction has been executed with errors.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.VariantCompositionRead(System.String@,System.Int32)

summary.para: The VariantCompositionRead instruction reads the current variant composition.

member.param: It identifies the variant composition (returned by this instruction).
The maximal length of the .

returns.para: This instruction returns the number of characters stored into the VariantComposition parameter.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.VariantCompositionWrite(System.String)

summary.para: The VariantCompositionWrite instruction writes the current variant composition.

member.param: It identifies the variant composition.

returns.para: ? not documented.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.Wait(System.Int32)

summary.para: The Wait instruction allows the firmware to wait for the specified number of milliseconds.

member.param: It identifies the wait time to be set.

returns.para: ? not documented.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgConnectAbus(Spea.Abus,Spea.Abus)

summary.para: The WfgConnectAbus connects the Wfg module to the specified line of the ABUS.
The connection of the points is added to those already connected, if any.
If the Wfg module is enabled, the instuction can not be executed.

member.param: It identifies the rows on OUT1.
It identifies the rows on OUT2.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_ABUS -> The ABUS row parameter is not valid.

summary.para: The WfgConnectInterf instruction connects the output channels of the Wfg module to the System Interface.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgConnectMobus(Spea.Mobus)

summary.para: The WfgConnectMobus instruction connects the output channels of the Wfg module to the modulation bus.
The connection of the points is added to those already connected, if any. The instruction connects the positive modulation line and the negative modulation line.
If the Wfg module is enabled, the instuction can not be executed.

member.param: It identifies the Mobus row.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_MOBUS -> The MOBUS row parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgConnectUabusBmu(Spea.Uabus1To4,Spea.Uabus5To8)

summary.para: The WfgConnectUabusBmu instruction connects the interface pins of the Wfg module to the UABUS rows of the YABMU board.

member.param: It identifies the UABUS rows on OUT1.
It identifies the UABUS rows on OUT2.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_UABUS -> The UABUS row parameter is not valid.

summary.para: The WfgDisable instruction turns off the instrument and stop the waveform generation.
The outputs are set to zero volt.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgDisconnectAbus(Spea.Abus,Spea.Abus)

summary.para: The WfgDisconnectAbus disconnects the Wfg module from the specified line of the ABUS.
If the Wfg module is enabled, the instuction can not be executed.

member.param: It identifies the rows on OUT1.
It identifies the rows on OUT2.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_ABUS -> The ABUS row parameter is not valid.

summary.para: The WfgDisconnectAll instruction disconnects the output stage of the Wfg module from every possible connection point.
If the Wfg module is enabled, the instuction can not be executed.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.

summary.para: The WfgDisconnectInterf instruction disconnects the output channels of the Wfg module to the System Interface.
If the Wfg module is enabled, the instuction can not be executed.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgDisconnectMobus(Spea.Mobus)

summary.para: The WfgDisconnectMobus instruction disconnects the output channels of the Wfg module from the modulation bus.
If the Wfg module is enabled, the instuction can not be executed.

member.param: It identifies the Mobus row.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_MOBUS -> The MOBUS row parameter is not valid.

summary.para: The WfgDisconnectUabusBmu instruction disconnects the Wfg module from the system interface and from the UABUS rows of the YABMU board.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.CdcollFileNameGet(System.String@,System.Int32@)

summary.para: This instruction returns the full path filename of the CDCOLL file for the specified site of the current test project.
If customized CDCOLL for each site is used, the site can be given to retrieve the cdcollName for the specific site.

member.param: It returns the cdcoll file name.
It identifies the site number.

summary.para: The WfgEnable instruction enables the Wfg module.
The instruction cannot be executed if the waveform is not selected (refer to the WfgWaveformSelect instruction).
and if the module input is set in INTSOURCE mode (refer to the Wfg InputSelect instruction).

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgInputSelect(Spea.WfgInput)

summary.para: The WfgInputSelect select the input stage of the Wfg module to the specified point to operate as a buffer.

member.param: It identifies the input point for the connection.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_SOURCE -> The Source parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgOutputSet(Spea.WfgOutputMode,Spea.WfgAmpRange,System.Double,Spea.WfgOffsetRange,System.Double,Spea.WfgImpedance)

summary.para: The WfgOutputSet intruction sets the instruments output parameters.

member.param: It identifies the output modality.
It identifies the range of the Amlitude value.

param.name: amplitude
param.para: It identifies the waveform peak amplitude (expressed in Volts).
This paramenter is used only if a Waveform Generator mode is selected, otherwise it is ignored by the system.

member.param: It identifies the range of the DCOffset value.
It identifies a DC offset that can be added to the generated waveform.
It identifies the range of the Impedance value.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_OUTPUT_MODE_SET -> The OutputMode parameter is not valid.
ERR_WFG_AMPLITUDE_RANGE -> The AmpRange parameter is not valid.
ERR_WFG_AMPLITUDE -> The Amplitude parameter is out of range.
ERR_WFG_OFFSET_RANGE -> The OffRange parameter is not valid.
ERR_WFG_DC_OFFSET -> The DCOffset parameter is out of range.
ERR_WFG_IMPEDANCE -> The Impedance parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgSequenceSelect(System.String,System.Double,Spea.WfgOutputFormat)
member.summary: This instruction loads on the YAGEN300 the customized waveform made by AWE2 editor.
member.param: It identifies the sequence name edited in the AWE2.
It identifies the test time of one waveform time point.
It identifies the type of the waveform to be generated.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_WFORM_TYPE -> The WformType parameter is not valid.
ERR_WFG_FREQUENCY -> The Frequency parameter is out of range.
ERR_WFG_OUT_FORMAT -> The OutFormat parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgTimingSet(Spea.WfgTiming)

summary.para: The WfgTimingSet instruction allows to select the timing to use when the Waveform Generator module is programmed in PULSE (refer to the WfgWaveformSelect instruction).

member.param: It identifies the timing to use in order to define the output pulse time.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_FLAG -> The Flag parameter is not valid.

member.name: M:Spea.LeoF.WfgWaveformSelect(Spea.WfgWaveformType,System.Double,Spea.WfgOutputFormat)

summary.para: The WfgWaveformSelect intruction sets the instrument to generate a standard-type waveform.

member.param: It identifies the type of the waveform to be generated.
It identifies the frequency of the generated waveform. In case of DC voltage generation the system software ignores this parameter.
It identifies the output voltage source origin.

returns.para: 0 -> The instruction has been successfully executed without errors.
ERR_WFG_NOT_PRESENT -> The Wfg module is not present.
ERR_WFG_WFORM_TYPE -> The WformType parameter is not valid.
ERR_WFG_FREQUENCY -> The Frequency parameter is out of range.
ERR_WFG_OUT_FORMAT -> The OutFormat parameter is not valid.

The lower threshold.
The upper threshold.

The upper threshold as string.
A list of test points used to perform this test.
An alternative message.
The site number.

Value indicating whether information should be logged to the "Certification Data Collection (CdColl)".

member.name: F:Spea.DriOutMode.DIRECT
member.summary: DIRECT = Direct Output mode.

member.name: F:Spea.DriOutMode.POWERV
member.summary:
POWERV = Output mode for fast voltage signals.
Caution is needed when using it, since during Toff the HOT wire is shorted with the COLD wire for discharging stray capacitance.
If capacitance is too high, high currents are expected that may damage the Driver output FET.

member.name: F:Spea.DriOutMode.POWERI
member.summary:
POWERV = Output mode for fast current signals.
Caution is needed when using it, since during Toff the HOT wire is shorted with the COLD wire for discharging stray capacitance.
If capacitance is too high, high currents are expected that may damage the Driver output FET.

member.summary: It identifies to skip the signature check. This setting is necessary only for some old family of Altera device.

member.name: M:Spea.TestEnvironment.TestEnvBase`2.Set(System.Func{`0,`0})
member.summary:
Sets the test environment to the desired state. The parameter should be used to describe the new desired state.
The default update order is: (DC-Generators, Stimuli, User Flags, FPS and Test Points). Any changes to the state will take priority over the default order.
member.param: A function which returns the desired state for the test environment.

remarks.example:
EXAMPLE
This example shows the test environment being used to connect test points 15, 30 and 31 to the ABUS, as well as set-up BSTV1 as power supply on this TPs.
It is presumed that an object testEnv was already initialized.
The command used will perform following actions:
User updates: - Disconnect any TPs that weren't mentioned or that changed connection. - Connect the TPs to the ABUS as aspecified. - Turn off and disconnect any stimuli that was used at least once throught the test environment and that wasn't mentioned or changed connection. - Connect and turn on the BSTV1 as specified. If BSTV1 was already connected as specified, it will only adjust voltage and current.
Default updates: - Now that user changes are done, the remaining actions are performed in the default order: * All DC-Generators are reseted. * All registered user flags are reseted. * All FPS that were used at least once through the test environment are deactivated.
private void CSharpExample(TestEnv<UserFlag> testEnv) { testEnv.Set(state => state.HasTpsConnectedToAbus(Abus.ABUS1, 30, 15) .HasTpsConnectedToAbus(Abus.ABUS4, 31) .HasStimuliOn( new StimulusConfig(StimulusId.BSTV1, 13.5, 0.8, StimulusConnectionPoint.ABUS1, StimulusConnectionPoint.ABUS4) ) ); }
Private Sub VBExample(testEnv As TestEnv(Of UserFlag)) testEnv.Set( Function(state) Return state.HasTpsConnectedToAbus(Abus.ABUS1, 30, 15) _ .HasTpsConnectedToAbus(Abus.ABUS4, 31) _ .HasStimuliOn( New StimulusConfig(StimulusId.BSTV1, 13.5, 0.8, StimulusConnectionPoint.ABUS1, StimulusConnectionPoint.ABUS4) ) End Function) End Sub

member.name: M:Spea.TestEnvironment.TestEnvBase`2.Modify(System.Func{`1,`0})
member.summary: Modifies the current state of the test environment without having to redescribe the complete target state.

member.name: T:Spea.TestEnvironment.TestEnv`2
member.summary: The test environment class provides capabilites for easily managing the state of common elements of a 3030 system in a centralized way. This includes setting up instruments and FPS, configuring user flags and connecting test points to the analog bus.
member.typeparam: This enum provides names for each user flag (example: ConnectCan).
This enum provides names for each pmx channel (example: DC-GenConnect).

member.name: M:Spea.TestEnvironment.TestEnv`2.#ctor(Spea.TestEnvironment.Fixture{`0,`1},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
There should be only one TestEnv object in a program.
member.param: The fixture object used for mapping the functionality of the user flags.
Enables logging of test environment changes.
